<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 119, 378, 144]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 221, 175, 250]]<|/det|>
CENTRE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 211, 425, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 722, 250]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[737, 211, 905, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 178, 292]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 276, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
0625/32  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 265, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Theory (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 300, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2020  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 383, 359, 399]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(10 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 603, 220, 618]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 619, 730, 651]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 845, 89]]<|/det|>
Some students observe drops of water falling from a tap that leaks, as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 102, 583, 312]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 332, 532, 350]]<|/det|>

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 363, 920, 396]]<|/det|>
The students measure the time for 50 drops to fall from the tap. The time for 50 drops to fall is 20 s.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 409, 599, 428]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 562, 920, 581]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
Some students determine the speed of a car on a road. The students measure the time for the car to travel \(30 \text{m}\) along the road. The time is \(5.4 \text{s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 482, 135]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 247, 920, 266]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 294, 146, 312]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 294, 920, 342]]<|/det|>
